{{also|nacht}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|nacht}}, from {{inh|de|goh|naht}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*nahts}}, ultimately from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*n√≥k ∑ts}}. Akin to {{cog|nl|nacht}}, {{cog|en|night}}, {{cog|da|nat}}, {{cog|got|êåΩêå∞êå∑êçÑêçÉ}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/naxt/}} * {{audio|de|De-Nacht.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Nacht.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|f||N√§chte}} # [[night]] #: {{ux|de|Die '''Nacht''' war lang und frostig.|The night was long and chilly.}} # [[darkness]] #: {{ux|de|Sie wurden von der '''Nacht''' verschlungen.|They were engulfed by the darkness (of the night).}} ====Usage notes==== * In contemporary German, ''Nacht'' is used somewhat differently than English ''night''. Although ''Nacht'' can be a general term for the dark hours of the day, when used as a time measurement it refers only to those hours when most ordinary people are in bed (roughly 11 p.m. till 6 a.m.). So while one says in English: ‚ÄúLet's have a beer tonight!‚Äù, in German one needs to say: ''Lass uns heute'' {{m|de|Abend}} ''ein Bier trinken!'' (‚ÄúLet's have a beer this evening!‚Äù) * A (masculine) genitive {{m|de|Nachts}} occurs only in the phrases {{m|de|des Nachts||at night}} and {{m|de|eines Nachts||one night}} and alone as the adverbial genitive {{m|de|nachts}}. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|pl=N√§chte}} {{Template:list:times of day/de}} ====Derived terms==== {{der4|de |die Nacht zum Tag machen |gute Nacht |gut' Nacht |gut Nacht |Kristallnacht |nachtaktiv |nachtblind |Nachtdienst |Nachtessen |Nachteule |Nachtfalter |Nachtgleiche |Nachthemd |n√§chtigen |Nachtj√§ger |Nachtjagdflieger |Nachtleben |n√§chtlich |Nachtlicht |Nachtmahl |Nachtmensch |Nachtmusik |Nachtquartier |Nachtreiher |Nachtruhe |nachts |Nachtsichtger√§t |Nachtshopping |Nachtspeicherheizung |Nachttisch |Nachtwache |Nachtw√§chter |Nachtzeit |Nacht und Nebel |Polarnacht |Reichskristallnacht |Tag und Nacht |Tagundnachtgleiche |√ºber Nacht }} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|heinacht}} * {{l|de|Fastnacht}} * {{l|de|Mitternacht}} * {{l|de|Nachtblindheit|g=f}} * {{l|de|Nachtschatten}} ====See also==== * {{l|de|Mitternacht}} * {{l|de|Tag}} * {{l|de|Mittag}} * {{l|de|Nachmittag}} * {{l|de|Abend}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Hunsrik== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|hrx|naacht||Wiesemann spelling system}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|hrx|goh|naht}}, from {{inh|hrx|gem-pro|*nahts||night}}, from {{inh|hrx|ine-pro|*n√≥k ∑ts||night}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/naxt/}} ===Noun=== {{head|hrx|noun|g=f|plural|Necht}} # [[night]] #: {{ux|hrx|Die '''Nacht''' is kalt.|The '''night''' is cold.}} ===Further reading=== * [https://hunsriqueanoriograndense.wordpress.com/dicionario-werterbuch/ Online Hunsrik Dictionary] ---- ==Pennsylvania German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|pdc|gmh|nacht}}, from {{inh|pdc|goh|naht}}, from {{inh|pdc|gem-pro|*nahts}}, ultimately from {{inh|pdc|ine-pro|*n√≥k ∑ts}}.
